title: Why did Europeans come to India in the 15th and 16th centuries? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was always trade. Elizabeth greatly expanded trade for England in the 16th century. She started trade with Russia too. She gave a charter to the East India Company. She got advanced sailing ships from winning the battle with the Spanish Armada. They brought spices and dyes, also pearls, gold, silver and other precious materials. The company specialized in spices,such as ginger, nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon and pepper, especially pepper. Later it was cotton, silk, indigo and tea, also saltpeter for gun powder.

Money! Exactly as Alice Gordon says. They wanted to buy local products directly, cutting out middlemen such as the Turks, & sell any of their own products that the locals might want to buy - for profit.
